page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: In 1908 the Ornamental Pond was well laid out. There was clear water for the swans to swim in, and the pond was surrounded by young elm trees, rock and pathways. With a number of seats for visitors to sit on while the children played, and also were well tended shrubberies. But now sadly the pond is overgrown and untidy, and receives very little attention. There are rotting tree stumps where huge elms once stood but have now been felled due to the Dutch Elm disease. Some of the remaining elms are good, specimens reaching to a height of sixty feet, but a few appear to be in trouble. There is no trace of the shrubberies today, nor the pathways, and swans no longer use it. Various branches, weeds and rubbish have been thrown in the pond by careless youths. Janine Scott.
